result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Lee Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is currently serving or any sentence defendant will be serving.

Not allowed to vote or sit on a jury until civil rights are restored.  
Remit fines and costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
